DateMacro.home.title=Date Macro
rendering.macro.date.name=Date rendering.macro.date.description=Use the date macro to set and format due dates within task macros and more! rendering.macro.date.parameter.value.name=Date value rendering.macro.date.parameter.value.description=The value of the date. It should be written in the format specified as a parameter or in the format generated by the date picker. rendering.macro.date.parameter.format.name=Date input format rendering.macro.date.parameter.format.description=The format the `value` parameter should have, specified in the Java Date Format Standard. For example, if you want to input the value parameter in the following manner `01 jan 2024`, the format parameter should look like this `dd MMM yyyy`. rendering.macro.date.parameter.displayFormat.name=Date display format rendering.macro.date.parameter.displayFormat.description=The format that will be used to display the date. The format should be in the Java Date Format Standard. For example, if you want the macro to display the date in the following manner `Sunday, 22.01`, this parameter should have the following value `EEEEE, dd.MM`.
DateMacro.Code.ConfigurationClass_storageDateFormat=The format that will be used to store dates used in Task Manager. DateMacro.Code.ConfigurationClass_displayDateFormat=The format that will be used to display dates used in Task Manager.
